Unit Master Documentation

Joint Member Registration

A guided document to help you register joint accounts correctly and capture all required details.

Joint Members allow two or more people to share an investment account under one mandate. Use this guide whenever you are creating a joint account so that names, contact information, statutory details, account preferences and bank details are captured accurately for every joint holder.

Joint Member Registration
Approx. completion time: 5–7 minutes
Multiple account holders
1

Opening the joint member registration

Log into Unit Master and go to the Members area from the left navigation menu. Click Add a New Member to launch the registration wizard. From the member type options, choose Joint Member to load the correct joint registration form.

The wizard for joint members follows a similar flow to single members, but it includes additional fields that capture information for more than one account holder and define how they can operate the account together.

2

Group or joint details Names & effective date

On the first screen, enter the basic joint account details:

  • Full Names of Joint Member(s) – type the full names of all joint holders as they appear on their identification documents.
  • Effective Date – select the date on which the joint member agreement becomes effective. This is usually the date the form is signed.

Ensure spelling is correct for every name, as these details will appear on statements and other official records.

3

Contact details and communication preferences

Next, capture the contact and communication details for the joint account. Follow the same approach as for a single member, but ensure that information covers all relevant joint holders where required.

Location information:

  • Postal Address – mailing address for official correspondence.
  • Postal Code – ZIP or postal code.
  • Country of Residence – country where the joint members reside.
  • District – administrative district or region.
  • Town – city or town of residence.

Contact details:

  • Mobile Phone No – primary contact number with country code.
  • Telephone No – optional secondary number.
  • Email Address – main email address for account communications.

Communication preferences:

  • Accept SMS Notifications – choose whether to receive alerts by SMS.
  • Send SMS Queries – allow the service to send follow up queries via SMS.
  • Receive Statement Via – choose Email (recommended) or Postage Mail where postal delivery may incur an additional fee.

Additional information:

  • Physical Address – full street address for the joint members.
  • Account Mandate – defines how many people must sign for transactions (for example, “Any one to sign”, “All to sign”, or “At least two to sign”).
4

Statutory details and compliance Residency & tax

The Statutory Details section ensures the joint account meets regulatory requirements. Work through each part carefully.

Residency and citizenship:

  • Is client resident? – confirm whether the joint account holders are resident in the country.
  • Has dual citizenship? – indicate if they hold more than one citizenship.
  • Is client a US citizen? – required for FATCA reporting where applicable.

Tax information:

  • Tax No – enter the tax identification number or PIN.
  • Is client tax exempt? – specify if the account qualifies for tax exemption.
  • Exempt Certificate Expiry Date – if exempt, provide the certificate expiry date in the requested format.

Account preferences:

  • Do you want to withdraw Monthly Interest? – choose whether interest is paid out monthly or left to accumulate.

Compliance screening:

  • Has Adverse Media Screening been done? – confirm completion of checks.
  • What is the screening status? – select True if passed, False if failed.
  • Is member a PEP? – indicate whether any holder is a Politically Exposed Person.

Document processing dates:

  • Client sign-off date – date when the joint holders signed the forms.
  • Admin received date – date when the documents were received by the office.
  • Risk Assessment completed date – date when the compliance review was finalised.
5

Account details for the joint investment

In the Account Details step, define how the joint funds will be invested:

  • Fund Name – select the investment fund where the joint account money will be placed.
  • Fee Category – choose the relevant fee structure (for example, retail, institutional, or premium).
  • Agent Name – assign the financial advisor or agent responsible for this account.
  • Show Tax on Statement? – decide whether tax should be shown clearly on statements.
  • Withdraw Dividends? – choose whether dividends are paid out as cash or reinvested.
  • Note / Instructions – optional text box for any special handling instructions.
6

Bank details for joint withdrawals Payout account

Finally, decide how to handle Bank Details for the joint account. You can either capture them now or skip and add them later in settings.

Step 1 – Choose option:

  • No – I want to provide bank details – opens the bank form below.
  • Yes – skip for now – allows registration to finish without bank data.

Step 2 – If providing bank details, capture:

  • Bank Name and Bank Branch
  • Account Number – double check for accuracy, numbers only.
  • Account Name – exactly as it appears on the bank account.
  • Currency – for example KES, USD or EUR.
  • Account Type – Savings, Current, or other available types.
  • Default Account – choose Yes if this should be the primary payout account for withdrawals.

When all sections are complete and checked with the joint holders, click Finish to submit the application and create the joint member account.
